thread.title: H.S. boys soccer: Player of the Year watch, Oct. 21, 2015 - Boys Soccer
thread.title_full: H.S. boys soccer: Player of the Year watch, Oct. 21, 2015 - Boys Soccer - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: H.S. boys soccer: Player of the Year watch, Oct. 21, 2015 - Boys Soccer
text:
Boys soccer player of the year watch 
(All statistics and records are through Monday)
Rene White, Hawthorne Christian, sr. F
White scored a goal in a 3-2 loss to Emerson. Then he had three goals and three assists in a 6-0 win over Cresskill. In the Passaic County tournament semifinals, White delivered three goals and an assist against Wayne Hills to send the Defenders to their first PCT title game in school history. 
Ervin Gjeli, Hasbrouck Heights, jr. M
Gjeli had five goals and an assist in an 8-1 win over Paterson Charter. He scored a goal in a 2-1 win over Becton and had four goals in a 5-4 win over North Arlington, including his 35th of the season.
Cristiano Neves, North Arlington, jr. F
He had a goal when the Vikings edged Becton, 2-1, then a goal and an assist in a 2-0 win over Saddle Brook. He had all four goals in the Vikings’ 5-4 loss to Hasbrouck Heights.
Alex Kasperowicz, Wayne Valley, sr. F
Kasperowicz scored all three goals, including the game-winner in the first sudden-death overtime, to send ninth-seeded Wayne Valley past fifth-seeded Clifton, 3-2, in the Passaic County tournament semifinals. On the season, Kasperowicz has seven goals and one assist with three game-winning goals.
Ryan Miller, Pascack Valley, jr. M
Miller had a goal in a 3-1 win over Tenafly. Then he scored two goals when the eighth-seeded Indians edged top-seeded Bergen Catholic, 3-2, in two overtimes in the Bergen County tournament quarterfinals. On the season, Miller has 16 goals and five assists. 
— Ed Mills
